text: Bottle, consumed in August 2014: Deep russet in color. Persistent off-white foam. Spellbinding aromas of vanilla toffee, smoke, poundcake, creamed coffee, milk chocolate, and licorice-y Spalter. Soft and creamy carbonation. Extraordinarily juicy, fat and finely polished malt exhibits rich melanoidins which massage and caress the tongue. Quite beautifully textured and notably pure malt character. Succulent tropical fruit esters join an explosive red plum flesh sweetness which causes the lips to smack. Silky layers of coffee-infused vanilla cake and toffee sparkle in the immaculately clean finish. A spectacular display of vivid malt, teeming with mouthwatering melanoidins. The lower alcohol combined with super clean fermentation makes this so much fun to throw back in large gulps. World class lager!
user_location: Blue Ridge Mountains, North Carolina, USA

text: Bottle at the brewery. Pretty orange-brown color. Really nise rounded malt nose, caramel. Good use of hops, some orange and then a prickly finish. Light and crisp, some apricots. Good.

Freshly made taster, 4.7 % abv, on a visit to the brewery. Solid white head to a cloudy dark apricot coloured body. Inviting malt-fruity aroma. Fresh and dried fruits in a well-blended flavour profile. Fruit hoppy ending, semi-dry. Medium bodied. Likable (Schnaid, Hallerndoft 11.10.2014).
Smells of black licorice and candy. Looks amazing with a dark red color. Malty and clean finish. Pretty good

Bottle in Strassgiech.

Head is initially large, fully lasting.
Body is dark amber.

Aroma is moderately malty (cookie, caramel, roasted hazelnuts), with notes of honey, toffee, orange peel, hint of smoke.

Flavor is moderately sweet, lightly bitter.
Finish is lightly sweet, lightly to moderately bitter.

Medium body, watery texture, lively carbonation.

Incredibly alluring nose, but the mouth experience didnt quite live up to its promise...doesnt have the usual silky mouthfeel. And yet still an excellent beer overall. Had a hard time competing with the other stuff Andy brought out that night in terms of complete drinking pleasure, but still every time I went to sniff the glass of this one I was amazed at the nose.
Bottle @ Zoiglstube. Pours ruby amber with a small white head. Very malty. Bread, caramel and chocolate. Mild yeast and fruit. Pleasant and tasty.
Hazy dark amber with a lasting white head. Malty aroma of fresh grain, caramel and bread crust. Dry and malty flavour with bready character, grass and hay and a rather hoppy finish

UPDATED: NOV 28, 2014 Multiple bottles at Zoiglstube Ganstaller in Strassgiech.
Batch 1 sampled in 2012.
Batch 2 sampled in 2013.
toasty red apple and caramel malt aroma and flavor; medium sweet, superbly soft carbonation gives it a soft yet thick texture.  beefy amber malts and clean red apple esters at play. a hearty and toasty malt experience.
Wässrig dunkel wässriger Antrunk. Etwas würziger werdend, trocken, laff. Wenig aromatischer Abgang. 10/7/8/7//7

29/09/2012 Ma che siete venuti a fà (tap). Bruna, abbastanza limpida, riflessi  color miele di castagno, schiuma biancastra porca, morbida, non molto abbondante, abbastanza persistente. Al naso sentori di malti tostati, caramello, leggera luppolatura. In bocca è dolciastra, caramellata, tostata, piacevolmente bilanciata sullamaro. Corpo leggero, piacevolmente "watery", carbonatazione corretta. Non sono certo un amante del genere, ma questa è la miglior dunkel mai bevuta, senza ombra di dubbio.

Tasted at the brewery with Andreas. hazy dark orange/brown appearance with a cream colored head. Incredibly uniquely spicy, nutmeg toasty, dark malty aroma. Delicious cocoa, rich nutty, very toasty malty flavor. Unbelievable delicious. A real fucking treat.
